titlestmt.titleproper: Miscellaneous maps and rolled items undated
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of reproductions and reprints of historical and contemporary maps of Pennsylvania and New Jersey. There are also a few other items, such as a Lovell family tree, some blank genealogical charts, and a reproduction of the Declaration of Independence. Maps include: Frankford, Pennsylvania, 1878 (photocopy); Philadelphia by Benjamin Eastburn, 1776 (photocopy); Philadelphia, 8th Ward, and 23rd Ward, J. L. Smith Company, circa 1960; Philadelphia, 23rd Ward; Philadelphia to Tinicum Island, Henry D. Paxson, 1926; Chester County Map by James Hindman, 1816 (reprint); Pictorial Map of Historic Delaware County, 1976; Plan of the Operations of General Washington against the King's Troop in New Jersey, 1777 (reprint from 1968); West Chester Quadrangle, by Chester County Planning Commission (U.S. Geological Survey), 1966; Map of Some of the South and Eastbounts of Pennsylvania (reprint of early map, probably late 17th Century showing trees and waterways); Plan of the Town and Harbor of Boston, 1775 (facsimile of original at Yale); Pilgrim Anniversary Print, 1970; Satellite Map of New Jersey (U.S. Geological Survey); Map of the Township of Birmingham showing the original grants (Bucks County); Historama of Colonial New Jersey, 1962; Map of the Historic Main Line (1979 reprint of 1953) and advertisement for map; Road Map of Bedminster Township, 1966 (Bucks County); and Map of East Bradford and West Bradford, 1912 (Chester County) (reproduction of original map).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
